--Rukus--

The pod screamed across the sky, blazing a trail right through the 
clouds as it made it's way down to the planet. Beside punching a 
hole through a flock of birds which were unfortunate enough to be in 
the path of the fireball, the initial part of the decent was 
uneventful. The landing was somewhat more interesting.

The pod came down somewhat hard, but as luck had it, it glanced off 
of a lake and rolled for about a kilometre knocking down a few trees 
before coming to a rest in an upright position in a snow patch. Base 
scanners showed the pod landing in the Rocky Mountains near a 
smallish lake around the US-Canada (locations with reference to the 
future's locations). A scanning device popped up out of the top of 
the pod, and proceeded to scan the area.

The scanning device selected two life forms it picked up: a black 
wolf, and a white and black fox. The computer melded the two forms 
together, choosing the black wolf as the dominate side, and then 
outputed a digital 3 dimentional view of the transformation mode to 
the pods occupant.

The pod was then silent for a few minutes, and some of the wildlife 
started to casually walk away, ignoring it. Then suddenly there was 
a hissing noise that came from the pod. The front fireshield raised 
slowly as a moderate amount of mist spewed out of the once sealed 
chamber. As the mist finished emptying itself, a mostly black bot 
with some white parts stepped out and looked around.



--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Jeff" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> ooC: 
> 
> Well, things have settled down enough for me to have time to 
rejoin 
> the RPG for a while, probably the summer, but whatever, i'll enjoy 
> it while it lasts. ^^
> 
> biC:
> 
> In the far reaches of the universe - well, it's pretty hard to say 
> HOW far with the universe in question - a military weapons 
> developement space station of the Autobot-Decepticon alliance, 
named 
> Berthyscape, was working on a new weapons tech. Their scientists 
had 
> recently started experimenting on harnasing the power of a small 
> black-hole.
> 
> As with most things, not fully understanding what you are doing 
can 
> often prove fatal. The Scientsts, proved this when one of the 
black-
> holes they were working on began to rupture it's containment 
field. 
> A code red alert was initialized, and evac began immediately. It 
was 
> soon realized, however, that there would be no escape from this 
> phenomenon by simply trying to leave the area. So, in an attempt 
to 
> save all of their lives, the head scientist initiated another 
> project that had also been worked on at the time: the time-warp 
rift 
> device. At the moment, they could only figure out how to open it 
up, 
> not how to pinpoint target locations. Things that went in were 
never 
> returned, and the time readings that were sent back were all 
> different from the space station time. Due to these problems, 
> research on the time-warp rift tech was not high proirity.
> 
> The head scientists enabled the device, and opened up the time-
warp 
> rift in the space station. The black-hole, the escape pods, and 
the 
> station itself were all sucked in. Although they hadn't discovered 
> this yet, objects which enter a time-warp rift without some sort 
> method of normalizing the time fluctuations, would end up spat out 
> at random times and in random locations. Following this principle, 
> all of the pods, the station, and the black-hole were then spit 
out 
> at various times and places.
> 
> One pod found it's way to a planet, which (though the bot inside 
the 
> pod didn't know it) happened to be inhabited. His onboard computer 
> listed the planet as unknown, with similarities to an ancient 
planet 
> which destroyed itself, Terra, or more commonly known as Earth to 
> it's weak but self-destructive beings which inhabited it 
originally.
> 
> His pod splashed into the upper atmosphere and streaked across the 
> sky leaving a tell tale - not that he knew this - sign of a new 
pod 
> entering the the brewing conflict between various forces of 
> transformers which had already found themselves stuck on this 
> archaic planet.
